ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Scale to assess use of therapeutic exercises (PT, OT, etc.) as other treatment for pain within the past 4 weeks
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Less than 1 day/week; 2= Weekly; 3= 2-4 days/wk; 4= Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Scale to assess use of hands on treatments (like massage or chiropractic) as other treatment for pain within the past 4 weeks
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Less than 1 day/week; 2= Weekly; 3= 2-4 days/wk; 4= Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Scale to assess use of modality treatment (TENS, ice, heat, etc.) as other treatment for pain within the past 4 weeks
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Less than 1 day/week; 2= Weekly; 3= 2-4 days/wk; 4= Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Scale to assess use of behavioral or mental health provider treatments as other treatment for pain within the past 4 weeks
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Less than 1 day/week; 2= Weekly; 3= 2-4 days/wk; 4= Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Scale to assess use of anxiety medications as other treatment for pain within the past 4 weeks
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Less than 1 day/week; 2= Weekly; 3= 2-4 days/wk; 4= Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Scale to assess use of NSAID medications including aspirin as other treatment for pain within the past 4 weeks
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Less than 1 day/week; 2= Weekly; 3= 2-4 days/wk; 4= Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Scale to assess use of cannabis products including CBD and marijuana as other treatment for pain within the past 4 weeks
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Less than 1 day/week; 2= Weekly; 3= 2-4 days/wk; 4= Daily or almost daily
